summary:
I’m an experienced and hands-on communication professional with a passion for driving change by engaging people through impactful strategic storytelling. I help connect teams and organisations through a shared purpose, strategy, and values and by driving brand ambassadorship and pride.

I have been a strategic internal communications business partner in four leading Fortune 500 companies: Unilever, Vodafone (including VodafoneZiggo), Booking.com and Randstad. In these roles I have been working closely with executive leadership, senior management, Finance, Marketing, R&D, Corporate Affairs, HR and IT on strategic internal communications and engaging employees in times of change.

I live in Amsterdam, together with my partner Yvette, daughter Myrthe and son Lieuwe. My personal interests include travel, foods, arts, media, and digital technology. I love to create communication and content that makes impact and to bring people together to create better results.

awards.title: Prof. Cees van Riel Award for lmpact & Excellence in Corporate Communication 2017
awards.description:
The Cees van Riel Award was established in 2017 in recognition of the vision and leadership of
Professor Cees Van Riel as the founder of the international Master programme in corporate
communication and as a pathbreaker in developing and strengthening the professional discipline of
corporate communication. His efforts and achievements, as well as his strive for excellence and impact
in academic research and education, are reflected in this Award.

In 2017, the Jury consisting of Prof. dr. Cees van Riel, Prof. dr. Joep Cornelissen, Prof. dr. Pursey Heugens,
Dr. Guido Berens and Marijke Baumann MSc, awarded the Cees van Riel Award for lmpact & Excellence in Corporate Communication 2017 for my Master's Thesis 'Visions and Reflections: How CEOs and their executive leadership team play an increasingly important role in driving strategic communication'. As argued by the Jury, "the thesis combines the highest level of academic rigour with practical relevance and a practically important question," and "thus meets the double hurdle of both academic rigour and practical relevance that is the hallmark of this Award."

profile_positions.description: In this role I helped building the new internal communications team (6 FTE) as part of the growing Corporate Communication department. I started during the Covid pandemic, working from home. This role saw many transformational challenges, including building the new (internal) communications team, building the (new) leadership, building the (internal) communication function, changing the culture and way of working, as part of the digital transformation at Randstad Group and the Marketing Department.
profile_positions.title: Manager Internal Communications

profile_positions.description: I have been working in the Global Employee Communications & Events Team at Booking.com. I joined this team in 2019 to support the CTO and the Technology department in building their communication and events in a time of transformation. In 2020 I have been shifting my focus to help evolve and improve the global communication channels and capabilities needed to deal with the challenges of the Covid-19 Crisis, and the impact it had on the business and employees.
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications Manager

profile_positions.description: At VodafoneZiggo I have been supporting the merger of the Vodafone Group and Liberty Global companies Vodafone and Ziggo in the Netherlands. We started the pre-merger activities in February 2016 and completed the formal merger on 1 January 2017. After that I was involved in the introduction of the new purpose, strategy and values of the new company, supporting the new (executive) leadership team, and the opening of the brand new VodafoneZiggo Head Office in Utrecht - with a big year long engagement and change programme focused on bringing together 1600 people from four offices in one exciting new place.
profile_positions.title: Internal Communications Manager

profile_positions.description: From October 2013 until December 2016 (until the merger of Vodafone Netherlands with Ziggo) I have been Internal Communications Manager at Vodafone Netherlands. In this role, I have been the country communications lead and communications advisor to two consecutive CEOs and their General Management Teams. I have been developing and implementing the Vodafone Netherlands communications strategy supporting the Vodafone Netherlands strategy. In three years’ time, our Always Easiest! strategy, Vodafone 2020 Vision, We CARE customer promise and Employer Brand campaign have led to significant and consistent business, employer branding and employee engagement improvements. Since February 2016 I've been part of the core pre-merger integration team preparing the merger of Vodafone Netherlands and Ziggo into the Dutch Joint Venture VodafoneZiggo, which completed on 31 December 2016.
